headline: It's Necessary: Gov. DeWine firmly in the pocket of gun lobby
author: Kevin Necessary
sentences: But much like he did when he cowed to extremists during the pandemic, DeWine has again shown he'll put politics before the safety of Ohioans.

Special to The Enquirer
In the aftermath of the 2019 mass shooting in Dayton, Ohioans gathered at a vigil for the victims.
DeWine did do something: He showed he was firmly in the holster, er, pocket, of the gun lobby and right-wing politics.
The governor signed into law a bill that eliminates training and permits for Ohioans to carry concealed firearms.
It even eliminates a requirement for people to inform law enforcement officers whether they're packing heat.
The new law might help DeWine bolster his reelection bid and fend off his far-right challengers.
Mike DeWine, pressing him to take action that would prevent more senseless gun deaths.
Kevin Necessary is an illustrator and editorial cartoonist.
His editorial cartoons appear Sundays in The Enquirer.
Those in the crowd began shouting "Do something!"
Why his gun record leaves him open to attack.
